doc.field: International Federation of Professional and Technical Engineers, Local 66 Records
International Federation of Professional and Technical Engineers, Local 66 Records

General Bronze Corporation: Correspondence: 1945-1947 postwar: layoffs, rehires for a new plant, scarcity of highly skilled draftsmen; 1952 minutes of special employees meetings 1954 - company executive v.p. is former union member; averting a contract strike; JLR on runaway shop in N. Dighton, Mass.; 1956-1958, new units of engineers are created for "methods" and "electronics". 1958 - growing labor-management hostility. (Discarded NY Times 2/28/60, engineering ads pp F 13-25); 1961- report of forced retirement issue; (1961 and 1963) "gripes" include charges of factionalism, problems with the business manager (before and after Raimist's resignation and the 1962 strike), one grouping allegedly influenced by a hostile chief draftsman (former union member); one-day walkout and 1964 reprimands to members accepting overtime.
